page.title: 16STOCKPORT TELEPHONE EXCHANGE
page.content:
The Stockport Telephone Exchange, opened in 1960, is an Auto-Manual Exchange with 96 operators. It employs 106 staff during the day and 54 on the night shift (6pm to 8am).
The Exchange handles 6,000 daytime enquiry calls and 900 at night.
The week day peak call times are from 9.30am to 11.30am and from 2.30pm to 3.30pm when most business telephones are in use. The other peak call time is just after 6pm when the cheap rate occurs.
The Exchange handles, on average, 70 emergency calls per day. This figure often increases with nuisance calls during the school holidays.
